content.question: A <math alttext="chi square" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> goodness-of-fit test where all assumptions were met yielded the chi-square test statistic <math alttext="chi square equals 1.92" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>1.92</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and a corresponding <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.75. The researcher interpreted the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value as a 0.75 probability of observing a test statistic of <math alttext="chi square equals 1.92" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>1.92</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> or larger. What is wrong with the researcher’s interpretation?

choices.label: The researcher did not state that the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is conditional on the null hypothesis being true.
The researcher interpreted the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value as the probability of observing 1.92 exactly.
The alternative hypothesis is not stated.
The significance level is not stated.
The degrees of freedom are not stated.

content.answer: The researcher did not state that the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is conditional on the null hypothesis being true.

topic.text: 8.3: Carrying out a Chi-Square Goodness of Fit Test

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
